page.title: 08FARMING AROUND DACRE.
page.content: There are 7 farms in Dacre and 1 agricultural contractor.There was evidence of turnip crops and a little barley but the land is manly grassland. Most of the farms have silage equipment.Two men mostly work the farms.The farms have a slurry store and most have dairy herds with Friesian.Some farmers have suckling cows.The size of most farms is about 130_140 acres.When we were there they were haytiming.The farms have a mixture of new and old biuldings.They have cubicles and loose boxs and bull pens.Most of the land in Dacre is grass.Mr Bell the agricultural contractor silages for people and he combines for people in the surrounding area.Some sheep are kept on the surrounding valley grasslands.A daily collection of is made,live are auctioned at Penrith or Carlisle Marts
